I know it's horrible, but given the context I think I'd prefer this method to be surrounded by a catch Runtime exception / log warning ?
That's to ensure that any unforeseen issue with those proxy generation will indeed get us the "falllback the current state" behaviour we discussed.
(Especially as the method intentionally throws RuntimeException on any CNFE)

timeline.bodyText:
There's an important optimisation missing here: even if all proxies are generated upfront, we still initialize the Bytecode Provider!
The line final BytecodeProviderImpl bytecodeProvider = new BytecodeProviderImpl(); needs to become lazily evaulated if we aim to skip loading all those classes.
